meanings.definition: To dig or excavate (a hole or trench)
meanings.sent1: I will grav a hole in the backyard for planting flowers.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers will grav the foundation for the new building.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to grav a pretend treasure chest in the sandbox.
meanings.sent4: She had to grav deep into her memories to find the answer.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologist carefully graved through the layers of soil to uncover ancient artifacts.

meanings.definition: A ditch or trench for draining water
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the grav in the field helped prevent flooding.
meanings.sent2: The farmer dug a grav to direct water away from the crops.
meanings.sent3: The ducks happily swam in the grav after the storm.
meanings.sent4: The grav in the garden was filled with colorful pebbles.
meanings.sent5: The ancient city had intricate gravs that carried water throughout the streets.

meanings.definition: A unit of acceleration equal to the acceleration of gravity
meanings.sent1: The roller coaster reached a thrilling speed of one grav.
meanings.sent2: The spaceship experienced multiple gravs during takeoff.
meanings.sent3: The science class learned about the concept of grav in physics.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut felt the pull of grav as the spaceship orbited the Earth.
meanings.sent5: The gravitational force of one grav kept the planets in their orbits around the sun.
